content.question: The first derivative of the function <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="h prime of x, equals, 3 times the natural log of open parenthesis, 2 plus, the cosine of 2 x, close parenthesis, minus x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the second derivative of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="h double prime of x, equals, the fraction with numerator negative 6 times the sine of 2 x, and denominator 2 plus, the cosine of 2 x, end fraction, minus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. On what open intervals contained in <math alttext="negative 2 is less than x, is less than 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is the graph of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> both increasing and concave down?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 2 comma negative 1.486, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.486</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 0.250 comma 1.085, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.250</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>1.085</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 2 comma negative 1.486, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.486</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 0.250 comma 1.656, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.250</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>1.656</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 2 comma 1.085, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>1.085</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 1.047 comma negative 0.250, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.047</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.250</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 2 comma negative 1.486, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.486</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 0.250 comma 1.085, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.250</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>1.085</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
